DataElement.preferredName: Image Exam Negation Commence Reason Image Negation Commence Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.  2. The process by which a patient's condition is appraised or evaluated. (Taber's)_An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._To cause to start._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action._A grouping to describe why the imaging exam was not initiated.

(Taber's)_An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._To cause to start._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.:An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.  2. Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.
An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a clinician that is based on a physical exam, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:To cause to start.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/12/2013 released, updated CSIs, tt. 2/10/12 curated for 6700.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping to describe why the imaging exam was not initiated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Use of a syringe and needle to push fluids or drugs into the body; often called a "shot.": Complication; any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of (or because of) another disease.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Diagnostic, Therapeutic, and Research Equipment Failure

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Diagnostic, Therapeutic, and Research Equipment Failure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The device needed to perform or produce the diagnostic, therapeutic or research imaging did not function properly.

Concepts.definition: A manufactured object that is used to perform diagnostic, therapeutic or research activities.
A lack of occurrence or performance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An irrational fear of being in a confined space.

Concepts.definition: An irrational fear of being in a confined space.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
